headline: Southwest Airlines (LUV) Returns to Profitability, Challenging Valuation Caution Narratives
summary: Southwest Airlines (LUV) returned to profitability over the past year, with earnings now expected to grow a rapid 40.3% per year for the next three years. While the company’s net profit margin has improved and recent growth has been robust at 52.9% per year over five years, the current share price of $31.65 is trading well above an estimated fair value of $7.88 based on discounted cash flow analysis. Investors are watching strong projected profit growth as the main upside, even as premium...

headline: American Airlines Hikes Outlook, Southwest Posts Record Q3 Revenue
summary: Southwest beat Q3 estimates Wednesday. American Airlines topped views Thursday, raised its EPS guidance. Alaska Air reports Friday.

raw.headline: American Airlines Hikes Outlook, Southwest Posts Record Q3 Revenue

headline: Southwest Airlines (LUV): Evaluating Valuation After Surprise Profit and Record Revenue Drive Renewed Optimism
summary: Southwest Airlines (LUV) caught the market’s eye after posting a surprise profit and record operating revenue for the third quarter. The company’s upbeat outlook for fourth quarter revenue reflects strong demand, even amid industry headwinds. See our latest analysis for Southwest Airlines. After rallying on record quarterly revenue and upbeat guidance, Southwest Airlines shares have pulled back, finishing at $31.65 and logging a 6.25% drop over the past day. Despite recent volatility tied to...

headline: Airfares Continue to Rise as Carriers Push Premium Seats
summary: Travel demand was dented earlier this year as rising geopolitical tensions and uncertainty around President Trump's sweeping tariffs made consumers anxious about the economy.  United Airlines and American Airlines notched smaller gains on their top lines for the third quarter, saying that revenue from pricier premium-cabin seats outpaced sales in the main cabin.

headline: Southwest Airlines (LUV) Falls Hard on Dismal Q3

headline: Morning Movers: Tesla, IBM slipping following quarterly reports
summary: Stock futures were modestly lower as disappointing quarterly results from major tech names weighed on sentiment. Markets look set to open with a muted tone, reflecting a mix of elevated risk and uncertainty. Oil surged nearly 4% after the U.S. imposed fresh sanctions on Russia’s top oil companies, creating a shockwave across energy markets and raising inflation concerns. Concurrently, the dollar firmed against major currencies ahead of a delayed U.S. consumer-price report, while the yen weakened
